issues.title: Improve tests
issues.body: Port tests from `Test::Unit` to `RSpec`. Extend coverage.

issues.title: Configuration DSL
issues.body: Provide a DSL for configuration -- in addition to, or instead of, the current YAML format.

issues.title: Ruby API
issues.body: Provide an easy-to-use Lingo API -- just `require "lingo"` and go for it. In addition to that, provide sensible string extensions: `String#tokenize`, `String#lemmatize`, ...

issues.title: Performance improvements
issues.body: Runtime as well as memory optimization. Add benchmark and profiling instrumentation.

issues.title: Encodings and I18n
issues.body: Allow for handling of documents in various encodings, not just the one the dictionaries are encoded in. Maybe provide automatic encoding and language detection.

issues.title: Improve documentation
issues.body: Update and translate old API documentation, extend coverage. Add and extend user-oriented documentation (Readme, Getting Started, Tutorials, ...).

issues.title: Replace regex-based tokenizer
issues.body: Replace current tokenizer with a more robust and more flexible solution. Flexibility in terms of implementation, not necessarily customization. Based on Racc/Ragel/ANTLR/...?

commits.message: lib/lingo/text_utils.rb: Added encoding parameter to methods.
lib/lingo/text_utils.rb: Refactored to make lingo dependency optional.
lib/lingo/database/source/ (convert_line -> parse_line): Renamed method; made public.
lib/lingo/attendee/vector_filter.rb (forward_vector): Fix "no implicit conversion of Lingo::Language::Token into String".

lang/en.lang: Added suffix `es/is` to `s` and `ies/y` to `v`.

Examples:

- s: crises, parentheses
- v: accompanies, flies

lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb (find_seq): Reduced runtime complexity (Regex support).

BENCHMARKS (as reported by `time(1)`, Memory=`%M`, Runtime=`%e`, N=4):

* `test_many_permutations_simple_regex?`:

  * Memory +8% (39442 +/- 88 vs. 42592 +/- 91)
  * Runtime -99% (124.85 +/- 0.05 vs. 0.83 +/- 0.00)

* `test_many_permutations_complex_regex`:

  * Memory -0.3% (39549 +/- 190 vs. 39431 +/- 132)
  * Runtime +0.7% (62.55 +/- 0.44 vs. 62.96 +/- 0.44)

* `TestAttendeeSequencer` w/o `test_many_permutations_{simple,complex}_regex*`:

  * Memory +0.2% (41857 +/- 128 vs. 41960 +/- 29)
  * Runtime -0.3% (0.88 +/- 0.01 vs. 0.87 +/- 0.00)

NOTES:

* Only "simple" regular expressions covered (fixed-length, alternations).

Ref: 9a87654
lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb: Renamed `CLS` to `CLASS_RE` and restricted to lowercase ASCII letters.

lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb (find_seq): Reduced runtime complexity.

BENCHMARKS (as reported by `time(1)`, Memory=`%M`, Runtime=`%e`, N=4):

* `test_many_permutations`:

  * Memory +4% (39362 +/- 111 vs. 41038 +/- 88)
  * Runtime -98% (44.62 +/- 0.22 vs. 0.80 +/- 0.01)

* `test_many_permutations_regex`:

  * Memory +0.1% (39494 +/- 182 vs. 39539 +/- 109)
  * Runtime +18% (53.04 +/- 0.54 vs. 62.62 +/- 0.40)

* `TestAttendeeSequencer` w/o `test_many_permutations{,_regex}`:

  * Memory -0.2% (40604 +/- 1009 vs. 40503 +/- 132)
  * Runtime -0.3% (0.89 +/- 0.01 vs. 0.89 +/- 0.00)

NOTES:

* TODO: Regex support.
* Changed the order sequences are inserted into the stream.

Ref: 34c0b8e

lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb (find_seq): Reduced memory usage.

BENCHMARKS (as reported by `time(1)`, Memory=`%M`, Runtime=`%e`, N=4):

* `test_many_permutations`:

  * Memory -97% (1290109 +/- 50011 vs. 39406 +/- 122)
  * Runtime -30% (64.08 +/- 0.47 vs. 44.77 +/- 0.34)

* `test_many_permutations_regex`:

  * Memory -97% (1457381 +/- 21244 vs. 39472 +/- 208)
  * Runtime -28% (73.08 +/- 1.70 vs. 52.48 +/- 0.23)

* `TestAttendeeSequencer` w/o `test_many_permutations{,_regex}`:

  * Memory -0.7% (40300 +/- 48 vs. 40037 +/- 144)
  * Runtime -0.3% (0.88 +/- 0.01 vs. 0.88 +/- 0.00)

NOTES:

* Patterns are guaranteed to be unique due to array intersection in `process_buffer`.
* Result uniqueness constraint has been weakened to projection instead of pattern + token + projection.
lib/lingo/attendee/text_writer.rb (control): Support format directives in output path.
lib/lingo/config.rb: Fix reader for attribute set in `load_config`.

.travis.yml: Revert MRI versions to strings. (a7ab438)

[ci skip]
.travis.yml: Add MRI 2.3, allow JRuby to fail.

lib/lingo/filter/xml.rb: Pass encoding string to Nokogiri.

Closes #15.

lib/lingo/filter/: Yield individual lines.

Related to #15.
lib/: Removed support for deprecated options and attendee names.
lib/lingo/ctl/files.rb (copy): Fixed "no implicit conversion of Array into String". (b4d70cb)

lib/lingo/database.rb: Refactored backend selection.

LINGO_BACKEND will be enforced if specified.
lib/lingo/text_utils.rb: IO#set_encoding returns nil on JRuby 9000.
lib/lingo.rb: Fix for JRuby 9000 "code converter not found (UTF-8 to UTF-8)".

lib/lingo/ctl/files.rb (copy): Ignore local directory for source.

Would pick up local file if it exists (and then fail to copy: "same file").

lib/lingo/text_utils.rb (open_file): Handle BOM.

TextReader#file_type can't simply `rewind' anymore; use ruby-filemagic >= 0.6.4 instead.
lib/lingo/ctl/analysis.rb: Dropped `diff' in favour of multiple path arguments for `stats' and `trans'. (c61bae4)

lib/lingo/database.rb: " "/"-" permutation.

MultiWorder required modification due to differing number of tokens ("automatic data processing" = 3, "automatic data-processing" = 2).
README: Updated current stable Ruby version.
lib/lingo/attendee/noneword_filter.rb: Dropped in favour of VectorFilter.
README: Dropped reference to legacy version.
config/lir.cfg: Don't write log and analysis files in LIR mode.
lib/lingo/attendee/text_{reader,writer}.rb: Extracted TextUtils and added Gzip support.

lib/lingo/attendee/analysis_filter.rb: New filter.

Record tokens throughout the stack as a prerequisite.
lib/lingo/language/word.rb: Simplify lexicals logic w.r.t. compounds.

lib/lingo/attendee/dehyphenizer.rb: Removed.

No longer functioning without trailing hyphens. (d79d8e6)
test/ts_database.rb: Inflection by case not supported yet.
lib/lingo/attendee/{lsi,vector}_filter.rb: Moved TERMINALS constant to parent class.
lib/lingo/attendee/debugger.rb (process): Fixed wrong number of arguments error. (0189724)

lang/de.lang: Replace infix substitution `/en` with `ch/chen` (6a215ef).

Prevent overly aggressive identifications (e.g., "Fehlerfinden").
lib/lingo/attendee.rb: Include config file in invalid options warning (e099aaa).

Rakefile (test_ref): Work around test failures on JRuby due to varying floating point precision.

https://travis-ci.org/blackwinter/lingo/jobs/43734013
Rakefile (test_ref): Use Diff::LCS directly instead of going through Diff::LCS::Ldiff.run.
lib/lingo/attendee/vector_filter.rb: Added support for TFIDF scoring.
lib/lingo/deferred_attendee.rb: New attendee that defers all forwarding until end of processing.
lib/lingo/attendee.rb: Make forward and command public, dropping accept and listen.
lib/lingo/attendee/: Make init, control and process public.

lib/lingo/attendee.rb: Every attendee can init, control and process.

Also, simplify skip command logic.
config/{lingo,lir}.cfg: Binding for eval does know +cmd+ again. (0189724, 72024c6)
Use RUBY_ENGINE instead of RUBY_PLATFORM to detect JRuby.
lib/lingo/cli.rb (config_present?): Overwrite to apply custom logic.
lib/lingo.rb (invite): Warn about deprecated attendee names.

lib/lingo/attendee.rb: Warn about invalid options.

Related to #1.

lib/lingo/attendee/vector_filter.rb: Print position and byte offset with each word.

Closes #14.
Rakefile (test_ref): Include `lib` directory and skip missing files.

lib/lingo/attendee/tokenizer.rb: Record byte offset.

Related to #14.

lib/lingo/attendee.rb: Make #control and #process accept additional arguments.

Dropped AgendaItem along the way and extracted command responsibility from #forward.

lib/lingo/attendee/text_reader.rb: Don't remove line endings.

Let the Tokenizer handle all whitespace.

lib/lingo/attendee/tokenizer.rb: Record token position.

Related to #14.
Rakefile: Use test task from hen.
lib/lingo/app.rb (parse_options): Allow config argument when invoked as `rackup`.
lib/lingo/call.rb (talk): Accept any readable type as input in addition to strings.
lib/lingo/progress.rb (initialize): Restore signal handler without making assumptions about its type.
Moved dictionaries and configuration files to their designated subdirectories.
Rakefile: Update required Ruby version and switch to pessimistic dependencies.
lib/lingo/attendee/tokenizer.rb: Improved support for MediaWiki syntax.
lib/lingo/call.rb (talk): Added option to return raw results.
lib/lingo/attendee/vector_filter.rb (process): Print preamble to log file.
lib/lingo/ctl.rb (copy): Ask before overwriting existing files.
ru/: Updated and extended. (Yulia Dorokhova, Thomas Müller)
lib/lingo/srv.rb (talk): [FIX] Return value of _talk may be nil.
lib/lingo/attendee/tokenizer.rb (tokenize): Give more helpful error message.

de.lang: Include sample tokenizer rules.

[ci skip]
Rakefile: ruby-nuggets has been renamed to nuggets.
.travis.yml: C extension support is not available. (unicode)
lib/lingo/cli.rb: Nuggets::CLI has been extracted into the cyclops gem.
lib/lingo/config.rb (load_config): Include file in error message.
lib/lingo/language/grammar.rb (test_compound): Refactoring in preparation for including synonyms.
lib/lingo/progress.rb: Reset signal handler when done.
ru/: Updated and extended. (Yulia Dorokhova, Thomas Müller)
lib/lingo/database.rb (prepare_lex): Load suffixes from language config.

lib/lingo/database.rb (prepare_lex): Allow (and ignore) words after head noun.

- Inflect sequence of adjectives, starting at the beginning, followed by a noun.
- Introduced suffix for plurale tantum.
lib/lingo/attendee/synonymer.rb: Optionally generate synonyms for compound parts, too.
lib/lingo/language/dictionary.rb (select_with_suffix): Select full entry for lexicalized compounds iff head matches attr.

de/lingo-dic.txt: Added more gender information. (Part 2)

Source http://de.wiktionary.org/.

de/lingo-dic.txt: Added more gender information. (Part 1)

Source http://de.wiktionary.org/.

Streamline use of KEY_REF.

lib/lingo/language/dictionary.rb (find_synonyms): There should be no need to delete KEY_REFs.
test/: Added test for lexicalized compound. (33346b8)
Use OSI abbreviation for license in GemSpec.
lib/lingo/language/: Make lexicalized and algorithmically identified compounds behave the same.

lib/lingo/database/source/multi_{key,value}.rb (set): Always generate complete entries. (fb83169)

lib/lingo/language/lexical_hash.rb: No longer access database configuration at runtime.
lib/lingo/database.rb ([]): Dropped IDX_REF.

test/attendee/ts_synonymer.rb: Synonymer doesn't support +check+ option, Variator does.
lib/lingo/attendee/tokenizer.rb: Handle multiple rules of the same name.
lib/lingo/database.rb (uptodate?): Check for matching config, too.
lib/lingo/database.rb (prepare_lex): Treat compounds according to their head part.
lib/lingo/database/source/word_class.rb: Support encoding of compound parts.
lib/lingo/database.rb ([]=), lib/lingo/language/dictionary.rb (select), lib/lingo/language/lexical_hash.rb ([]): Don't sort dictionary values.
lib/lingo/database.rb (uptodate?): Check for matching version, too.
ChangeLog: Use FQCN for automatic linking. Cleanup.
lib/lingo/attendee/text_reader.rb: Switched to new PDF::Reader API and added pdftotext filter.
lib/lingo/database.rb (convert): Optionally inflect adjectives in multiword dictionaries.
Rakefile: 'doc/' and 'pkg/' are already clobbered through their respective tasks.
{de,en}/lingo-*.txt: Use shorthand notation for multiple word classes.
{de,en}/lingo-dic.txt: Fixed entries lost during automatic conversion. (0c967be, d2828e4)
lib/lingo/database/source/word_class.rb: Support encoding of gender information.
lib/lingo/attendee/text_reader.rb (filter_html): Hpricot is over, use Nokogiri instead.
{lingo,lir}.cfg: Binding for eval doesn't know +cmd+ anymore. (0406a11)
lib/lingo/attendee/abbreviator.rb: Send remaining abbreviation at EOF/EOR.

lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb: Allow arbitrary regular expression patterns.

The only restriction now is that the regexp must conatin any word class that is to be matched.

README: Link to GitHub releases instead of tags.

https://github.com/blog/1547-release-your-software
lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb: Substitute matching pattern in format string (0).

lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb: Allow regular expression patterns.

Only simple regular expressions with fixed length currently supported.

lib/lingo/attendee/sequencer.rb (process_buffer): Fixed multiword patterns.

Multiword expressions and components thereof cannot be part of the same sequence.
lib/lingo.rb (invite): Meeting config should have precedence over language config.
lib/lingo/language/word_form.rb (initialize): Use constant instead of string literal.
lib/lingo/database/show_progress.rb: Print location of reject file.
lib/lingo/attendee/multi_worder.rb (check_multiword_key): Correcting small glitch introduced in 64877cf.
Optionally prevent Lingo from sorting any results.
lib/lingo/srv.rb: Accept array of query strings.
lib/lingo/attendee/{noneword_filter,text_writer}.rb: Allow nonewords to be printed in dictionary format.
ChangeLog: Specify markup for RDoc. (Changed parsing of ChangeLog files in 4.0.0)
README: Point to Ruby 2.0.0 as the currently recommended version.
lib/lingo/attendee/text_reader.rb (spool): In absence of capture group for LIR record number, default to match string.
lib/lingo/web*: Added Russian localization (Yulia Dorokhova, Thomas Müller).
lib/lingo/web.rb: New parameter `hl` for UI language.

en/{wordnet-dic,ir-verben}.txt: Renamed to match standard pattern.

Also added to en.lang for immediate use.
Added Russian language support (Yulia Dorokhova, Thomas Müller).

issue_comments.body:
Looks like `Attendee::Abbreviator` is the one to blame:

![lingo-test-abbreviator.png](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20381/5644911/26287eca-9669-11e4-89b2-5adb5914bee0.png)
thanks for the reminder! i was already planning on doing that for quite a while ;)

Hi Thomas,

thanks for your report! I pushed a [prerelease gem](https://rubygems.org/gems/lingo/versions/1.8.8.pre1) that addresses the following issues:
1. `no implicit conversion of Encoding into String`: Changed `@encoding` to `@encoding.to_s` in `Lingo::Attendee::TextReader#filter_html`.
2. "xml document with many embedded \n, but lingo processed only the last line (wrt the \n) of this": Changed `x.text` to `x.text.each_line` in `Lingo::Attendee::TextReader#text_enum`.

Could you give it a try and report back? (`gem install lingo --pre` and then `lingo _1.8.8.pre1_ ...`)

I could not reproduce a case where `line` would be `nil` in `Lingo::Attendee::TextReader#control` (`undefined method 'bytesize' for nil:NilClass`). Could you maybe provide an XML file that causes this error?

Ok, I'll release version 1.8.8 (or maybe 1.9.0) soon.

> As for the open issue: It's not a nil "line" which triggered the original error, but "io" at close() time is not what it used to be at open() time.

The error `undefined method 'bytesize' for nil:NilClass` can only result from `line` being `nil`.

> You masked the error by introducing an "if io.respnd_to?(:close)" in 1.8.8.pre1, but I suggest that you have a closer look again at the line

That's correct, it was a quick fix. I'm going to refactor the code for the final release. However, the fact that `io` doesn't have to be an actual `IO` object is considered a feature. We sneak a different kind of object in its place if the original input is filtered through a type-specific processor.

Great, with your fixes my test XML file got processed like a charm.

As for the open issue: It's not a nil "line" which triggered the original error, but "io" at close() time is not what it used to be at open() time. You masked the error by introducing an "if io.respnd_to?(:close)" in 1.8.8.pre1, but I suggest that you have a closer look again at the line

```
pos = 0 unless pos?(io = filter(io, path, progress))
```

connected to the Progress.new() call between io.open and io.close: It seems that not all filter_something methods return something comparable to io, or - to stick with the facts I tested - at least text_enum(Nokogiri.send()...) is a completely different animal from the original "io" (a file). But maybe Nokogiri already closed the io object it had been processing and the whole question doesn't matter altogether...

Oh, without noticing I had been getting two different error messages on two systems (both with a plain install of lingo 1.8.7 with "@encoding" as parameter to Nokogiri.send() patched as "@encoding.name"):

What I had been trying to discuss was

```
/home/thomas/.gem/ruby/gems/lingo-1.8.7/lib/lingo/attendee/text_reader.rb:154:in `block in control': undefined method `close' for #<Enumerator: #<Enumerator::Generator:0x80bfc734>:each> (NoMethodError)
```

for the following setup

```
# Nokogiri (1.6.7.2)
---
warnings: []
nokogiri: 1.6.7.2
ruby:
  version: 2.2.4
  platform: i386-cygwin
  description: ruby 2.2.4p230 (2015-12-16 revision 53155) [i386-cygwin]
  engine: ruby
libxml:
  binding: extension
  source: system
  compiled: 2.9.3
  loaded: 2.9.3
```

But on the other machine (Debian jessie) I got (and pasted here):

```
/home/thomas/lingo-work/2lingo.xml: progress/var/lib/gems/2.1.0/gems/lingo-1.8.7/lib/lingo/attendee/text_reader.rb:144:in `block (3 levels) in control': undefined method `bytesize' for nil:NilClass (NoMethodError)
```

with the following setup:

```
# Nokogiri (1.6.3.1)
---
warnings: []
nokogiri: 1.6.3.1
ruby:
  version: 2.1.5
  platform: x86_64-linux-gnu
  description: ruby 2.1.5p273 (2014-11-13) [x86_64-linux-gnu]
  engine: ruby
libxml:
  binding: extension
  source: system
  compiled: 2.9.1
  loaded: 2.9.1
```

My "success" report from this afternoon was with regard to 1.8.8.pre1 under the Cygwin setup. But on the Debian setup it runs successfully, too!
